actions.description: List of actions that modify a repository.

active.description: Set to `false` to temporarily deactivate the task and prevent it from executing.

assignees.description: A list of usernames to set as assignees of a pull request.

autoCloseAfter.description: Automatically close a pull request if it has been unmerged for the duration. Format is seconds. Set to `0`, the default, to deactivate.

autoMerge.description: Merge a pull request automatically if all checks have passed and all approvals have been given.

autoMergeAfter.description: If set, automatically merge the pull request after it has been open for the specified amount of time. Only applied if `autoMerge` is `true`. The value is a Go duration, like 5m or 1h.

branchName.description: If set, used as the name of the branch to commit changes to. Defaults to an auto-generated name if not set.

changeLimit.description: Number of pull requests to create or merge (combined) in one run. Useful to reduce strain on a system caused by, for example, many CI/CD jobs created at the same time.

commitMessage.description: If set, used as the message when changes get committed. Defaults to an auto-generated message if not set.

createOnly.description: Create pull requests only. Don't attempt to update a pull request on a subsequent run.

filters.description: Filters make saturn-bot pick the repositories to which it applies the task.

inputs.description: Inputs allows customizing a task at runtime.

keepBranchAfterMerge.description: If `true`, keep the branch after a pull request has been merged.

labels.description: List of labels to attach to a pull request.

maxOpenPRs.description: The number of pull requests that can be open at the same time. 0 disables the feature.

mergeOnce.description: If `true`, no new pull request is being created if a previous pull request has been merged for this task.

name.description: The name of the task. Used as an identifier.

plugins.description: List of plugins to start for the task.

prBody.description: If set, used as the body of the pull request.

prTitle.description: If set, used as the title of the pull request.

pushToDefaultBranch.description: If `true`, push changes directly to the default branch, like "main". If `false`, create a pull request to submit changes.

reviewers.description: A list of usernames to set as reviewers of the pull request.

trigger.description: Experimental: Define when the task gets executed. Only relevant in server mode.

cron.description: Experimental: Trigger the task based on a cron schedule.

webhook.description: Experimental: Execute the task when the server receives a webhook.

delay.description: Experimental: Delay the execution of the task by this many seconds.

github.description: Experimental: Execute the task when the server receives a webhook from GitHub.

gitlab.description: Experimental: Execute the task when the server receives a webhook from GitLab.

action.description: An action tells saturn-bot how to modify a repository.

params.description: Key/value pairs passed as parameters to the action.
Key/value pairs passed as parameters to the filter.

reverse.description: Reverse the result of the filter, i.e. negate it.

input.description: A input allows customizing a task at runtime.

default.description: Default value to use if no input has been set via the command-line.

description.description: Text that describes the input value.

name.description: Key that identifies the input. Set via the command-line to set the input value.

validation.description: If not empty, a regular expression that validates the value of the input.

options.description: If not empty, a list of possible values for the input.

plugin.description: A plugin extends saturn-bot and allows custom filtering or modification of repositories.

configuration.description: Key/value pairs that hold additional configuration for the plugin. Sent to the plugin once on startup.

event.description: Experimental: GitHub webhook event, like push. See https://docs.github.com/en/webhooks/webhook-events-and-payloads for a list of all available events.

filters.description: Experimental: jq expressions to apply to the body of the webhook. If all expressions match the content of the webhook then a new run of the task is scheduled.

event.description: Experimental: GitLab webhook event, like push. See https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/integrations/webhook_events.html for a list of all available events.

filters.description: Experimental: jq expressions to apply to the body of the webhook. If all expressions match the content of the webhook then a new run of the task is scheduled.
